Description: About 60 fragments of a shallow blown glass bowl; colourless with polychrome design; rim outsplayed and knocked off; lip ground smooth; sides concave; bottom probably slightly convex, but perhaps flat; at rim, a red border on which are white dots, ovals and (?)leaves, divided by white line from central pattern; central pattern overall floral, perhaps with fruits(?) on a yellow background, details in linear black; design painted on inside.
Bibliographic references: Daniels et al 2014 / Technological insights into madder pigment production in antiquity (p.18, table.1)
